text: Dale Jonathan Winton (22 May 1955 - 18 April 2018) was an English television personality and DJ. He began his DJ career in 1982 by DJing on weekends. He was born in London. This led him to United Biscuits Industrial Radio where he did many kinds of jobs before getting his own morning show. After that, he joined Radio Trent in Nottingham. He was on a variety of different radio stations. He was a DJ on Radio 2. His television career began in 1987, working for Channel Four, the Lifestyle Channel. his best known television programme however was Dale's Supermarket Sweep It was broadcast from 1993 to 2007 on ITV with a new series in 2010 on Sky. He also acted in Pets Win Prizes, The Great British Song Contest, Gimme Gimme Gimme, Touch The Truck, Dale's Wedding, Celebrity Fit Club, Never Mind the Buzzcocks, In It To Win It, Show Me What You've Got and Hole In The Wall among other TV programmes. He had 1 hit single to date, his hit was as Dale Winton featuring Bar-codes & Alison Brown. It reached number 72 in 1994 Chartstats.com Winton was openly gay.I never told my mum I was gay Winton died suddenly on 18 April 2018 in London at the age of 62. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Actors from London Category:BBC radio presenters Category:BBC television presenters Category:British radio personalities Category:English LGBT people Category:English television actors Category:English television presenters Category:Gay men Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT broadcasters Category:ITV presenters Category:Radio personalities from London
title: Dale Winton
